p: Two tick species, Dermacentor silvarum and Ixodes persulatus were reported to harbor the pathogen of tularemia ( F. tularensis subsp. Holarctica) in the natural environment, indicating these two tick species might have a role in tularemia existence in China [ 10]. Rodents and wild animals are its main source of infection, and infection generally occurs in spring and early summer. Pathogens can survive in ticks for 200â€“700 days [ 12].
